DataElement.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the location at which an organization can be reached.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the location at which an organization can be reached.  (manualloy-curated)_Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry.

Concepts.definition: Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry.

Property.preferredDefinition: A standardized representation of the geographical location of a person, business, building, or organization.  In the US this usually consists of a street name and number, a city, a state, and a zipcode.

Concepts.definition: A standardized representation of the location of a person, business, building, or organization.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/16/09 - Released for use in caBIG candidate data standard.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: ST:  DICOM Short Text; A character string that may contain one or more paragraphs. It may contain the Graphic Character set and the Control Characters, CR, LF, FF, and ESC. Data Elements with this DICOM Value Representation shall not be multi-valued

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.:Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.
Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 6/21/07 - released for curation of NCIA DEs. 5/31/07-Create for CDEs using the DICOM Date format; based on 2007 DICOM Standard, section 3.

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 4/8/09 removed from imaging set 1 of proposed data standards pending resolution by caBIG CDE Leadership team of existing Address data standard.
